intro: Randia armata var. ferox, commonly known as the redroot sandmat, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers, which are followed by small, round berries. It is often found in sandy or disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in warm, humid climates. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
